image.altText: A crowd of people carry white flour bags

props.synopsis: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney says the move is predicated on the Palestinian Authority's commitment to reforms, including general elections in 2026 without Hamas's involvement.

title.children: Canada to recognise Palestine, as Chalmers says it's 'when, not if' Australia will follow

image.altText: Mark Carney gestures with his hands as he speaks at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Canada's move to join France and the United Kingdom by signalling it will recognise a Palestinian state reveals more about the highly coordinated international strategy on Gaza that now involves both Western and Arab nations.

title.children: A highly coordinated international strategy on Gaza is now unfolding

image.altText: Two women wearing University graduation gowns and mortar boards.

props.synopsis: Australians with student debts will have their HECS cut by 20 per cent after the government's bill passed the Senate. Follow live.

title.children: Bill to cut Australians' HECS debts by 20 per cent passes parliament

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: FBI director Kash Patel makes secretive visit to Australia
Jason Clare says student debt relief is now 'guaranteed'
Student debt relief passes the Senate

image.altText: Primary school children using pencils in class

props.synopsis: Artarmon man David James was charged by Australian Federal Police with more than a dozen offences, including 10 counts of using a child under the age of 14 to make child abuse material.

title.children: Sydney man who worked with kids charged with child abuse offences

image.altText: A man stands in the foreground with a picture of another man on a screen in the background.

props.synopsis: Police believe the missing remains of alleged murder victim Julian Story have been found by a member of the public, but say testing will be undertaken to confirm.

title.children: Breaking: SA Police believe missing remains of Julian Story have been found

image.altText: Man in suit wearing headset faces screen showing Jerome Powell

props.synopsis: The US president says the August 1 deadline for imposing higher "reciprocal" tariffs stands. Local stocks are poised to follow Wall Street lower after the US central bank left interest rates on hold. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Stocks fall as US rate cut hopes dashed and tariff deadline looms

image.altText: A small wood heater with fire wood

props.synopsis: A new generation of low-emission wood heaters that produce a fraction of the particulate pollution of current models could save lives by improving air quality, researchers say.

title.children: Why Australia hasn't adopted NZ's solution to wood smoke pollution

image.altText: Two cavoodles wearing a pilot and air hostess costume

props.synopsis: The airline has now received the green light from Food Standards Australia New Zealand, a major regulatory hurdle that stalled the rollout after Virgin first announced the plan last year.

title.children: Virgin Australia to allow pets on board before the end of the year

image.altText: Ben Stokes shakes hands with Ravindra Jadeja

props.synopsis: The infamous spirit of cricket debate is back after a tense ending to the fourth Test between England and India. It is time to accept that it doesn't exist.

title.children: Stokes-India handshake drama suggests 'spirit of cricket' may be a myth

image.altText: A lady at a park blurred to protect her safety

props.synopsis: The federal government is being urged to consider legal changes to allow the ATO to waive debts incurred through financial abuse, as the office ramps up use of its powers to recover $56 billion owed by small businesses and individuals.

title.children: ATO debt collector tells financial abuse survivor 'we go after the women'

image.altText: A painting of Indigenous musician William Barton in a living room, smiling brightly, holding a didgeridoo with one hand.

props.synopsis: Recovering from a painful injury, Loribelle Spirovski ditched her paintbrush to craft a portrait of William Barton. It just won People's Choice in the Archibald Prize.

title.children: Loribelle just won an art prize for a portrait she painted with her fingers

image.altText: A dark van with a stripe on the bottom and a roof rack in dirt around bushland.

props.synopsis: After Carolina Wilga's miracle survival in West Australian bush, local farmers have worked together and braved rough terrain to recover her abandoned van.

title.children: Volunteers recover German backpacker's abandoned vehicle

image.altText: A man does a thumbs up to the camera in an operating room next to a patient. He and another person wear gowns and masks.

props.synopsis: Former patients and colleagues of Greg Malham have contacted Four Corners to describe their own dealings with the neurosurgeon and what they say was inappropriate care and follow-up.

title.children: 'Sustained arrogance': More patients of 'spinal wizard' Greg Malham speak out

image.altText: Two students hold dusters to erase crosses on a board

props.synopsis: After 17 years of NAPLAN testing, Australia is yet to see a big turnaround in results — so what can be done to improve them?

title.children: 'Postcode, privilege' — not education system — shaping 'opportunity'

image.altText: A man pictured smiling at the altar on his wedding day.

props.synopsis: Father of two Brian Dean died of sepsis about 24 hours after he was discharged from a Geelong hospital. His family and their lawyer want a coroner to examine whether the death was preventable.

title.children: Brian was discharged from hospital. He died from sepsis the next day

image.altText: Anthony Field and a man with a beard pictured next to clouds

props.synopsis: Ozone therapy claims to reduce inflammation and even treat cancer, but there is limited clinical evidence that it works. So why are Australians spending thousands to use it?

title.children: The dead 'doctor' and cancer cure claims: Inside Australia's ozone therapy industry

image.altText: A blonde woman looking at the camera in a denim jacket

props.synopsis: Actor Sydney Sweeney's "good jeans" advertisement has sparked a debate about beauty standards and race.

title.children: Why an ad about Sydney Sweeney's 'great jeans' is facing a backlash

image.altText: A woman walking past a TV screen showing a tsunami evacuation notice.

props.synopsis: The East Asian country, sitting on one of the most geologically active parts of the world, is no stranger to the threat of tsunamis. That became clear as its 121 million people responded to Wednesday's threat.

title.children: How Japan was so well-prepared for the Russian tsunami threat

image.altText: Silhouettes of four people are seen in front of a purple background and a set of scales of justice

props.synopsis: One year since governments responded to the disability royal commission, those who poured their heart into it are wondering what has come of their efforts.

title.children: $600m, 4.5 years, 222 recommendations and little to show for it so far

image.altText: Arrest picture in Barangaroo

props.synopsis: Two Sydney men have been charged with almost 200 offences following a major fraud operation into a scam where luxury cars, homes and businesses were obtained.

title.children: Bentleys, Ferrari among $38m in assets seized as alleged fraudsters charged

image.altText: A police car and police tape seen blocking the scene of a residential street in Wollert, where a shooting took place

props.synopsis: Police are investigating a suspected targeted shooting after the discovery of a 21-year-old's body in Wollert. Separately, detectives have made five arrests in a "turning point" for their investigation into a fatal shooting almost two years ago.

title.children: Gunman at large after 21-year-old found dead in Melbourne's north

image.altText: Lindy Lucena

props.synopsis: The bashing death of Lindy Lucena at the hands of her partner and the slow police response will be investigated by the state coroner, following an ABC investigation.

title.children: Coroner to examine fatal bashing of mother following ABC investigation

image.altText: bruce lehrmann walking outside court

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann's Toowoomba rape trial will not go ahead until 2026 as the defence reveals a police hard drive has been destroyed and the complainant has made a new "invention" that was not in her original statement.

title.children: Investigation into Bruce Lehrmann rape charges still active, defence says

image.altText: A woman with a baby on her back with a rifle hanging on the wall in the background.

props.synopsis: Americans are being encouraged to have more children by the likes of Donald Trump, JD Vance and Elon Musk. And even though the risks for the poster families of pronatalism are real they are happy to bear them.

title.children: 'A worthwhile way to die': Inside America's pronatalist movement

image.altText: Lidia Thorpe Message Stick

props.synopsis: Independent senator Lidia Thorpe has warned Australia is at risk of "losing another generation" of First Nations people to the criminal justice system without urgent action from all levels of government.

title.children: 'Dismally failing’: State and territory funding cuts urged for Gap failures

image.altText: An illustration of a swimmer with a gold cap swimming in waves.

props.synopsis: After more than a decade challenging at the top of the swimming world, Cameron McEvoy is chasing perfection in a most unforgiving race.

title.children: With no leeway in a 21-second race, Cam McEvoy is hunting perfection

image.altText: A man wearing a chequered shirt and helmet sitting on a motorbike looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: The mother of teenage man, who died after he was hit by a car, says the bond she shared with her son was the most incredible thing she had in her entire life.

title.children: Friends, family pay tribute to beloved teen killed in crash

image.altText: Laura Dahlmeier skiing in a biathlon event with mountains behind her.

props.synopsis: German biathlete Laura Dahlmeier has died, aged 31, after being hit by a rockfall while climbing in the mountains of Pakistan.

title.children: Olympic gold medallist dies in mountain climbing accident

image.altText: People stand by the side of the road dressed in Black Sabbath tshirts.

props.synopsis: Fans of Black Sabbath frontman Ozzy Osbourne lined the streets of Birmingham in the UK to pay tribute to the late musician, while his wife Sharon was moved to tears as she laid flowers for her husband.

title.children: Ozzy Osbourne fans line Birmingham streets to pay tribute ahead of funeral

image.altText: GettyImages-2225126649

props.synopsis: Athletes will need to undergo chromosome tests by September 1 after World Athletics put a timeline on regulations aimed at proving biology.

title.children: World Athletics sets deadline for competitor chromosome tests

image.altText: England bowler Ben Stokes puts his hand behind his back while leaning forward during a Test match.

props.synopsis: England captain Ben Stokes should be fit for the Ashes in Australia despite succumbing to a shoulder injury before the final Test of the current series against India.

title.children: Ben Stokes still on track for Ashes despite succumbing to another injury

image.altText: Mollie O'Callaghan smiles with her gold medal after winning the women's 200m freestyle at the world swimming championships.

props.synopsis: Mollie O'Callaghan equals Grant Hackett with her 10th world championship gold, as Kyle Chalmers looks ominous.

title.children: O'Callaghan equals Aussie swimming legend with gold at world champs

image.altText: Australia's Christopher O'Connell pumping his fist on the tennis court

props.synopsis: Australian Christopher O'Connell has stunned Greek 23rd seed Stefanos Tsitsipas to advance into the final 32 of the Canadian Open.

title.children: De Minaur, O'Connell set up all-Aussie match, Joint out of Canadian Open

image.altText: A close-up photo of a camel with a leather riding bridle around its head.

props.synopsis: A Scenic Rim farmer is trying to build a livestock industry around camels, but says one of the biggest challenges will be changing public opinion about the feral pests.

title.children: Camel meat, milk and vodka on the menu, but feral pains persist
